venue.name: Emerson College, Huret & Spector Gallery Tufte Performance and Production Center

item.description:
Exhibit Reception and Inauguration: 6pm
Film Exhibit: 7pm

FADO, the most traditional Portuguese music genre, was added to UNESCO’s list of World’s Intangible Cultural Heritage by the end of 2011.

Through these 40 photographs you will be taken on a journey, deep rooted in Lisbon history, where Fado and the city grew “hand-in-hand”. The characters shown are ordinary people, who were photographed in action, whose feelings are outstandingly revealed in Pavão´s photos.

The movie to be shown afterwards, “Fados” directed by the consecrated Carlos Saura (2007), is a collection of performance pieces of Fado songs. They come together to give an idea of the musical style that reflects the history of the people of Portugal.

Please join us celebrating this wonderful genre of song, the fado

https://www.facebook.com/events/330137360337972/
http://www.bostonportuguesefestival.org/index.php

This is joint meetup with the Boston Culture Club,
http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Culture-Club/events/60487942/

if you are a member of both groups, please only reserve your attendance with one group so I can get an accurate attendance count..

Lets meet at the entrance at 6pm.
I will wait 10 minutes before heading into the exhibit.
Please plan to arrive on-time so we can all be sure to meet one another.

group.name: The Boston/Cambridge Portuguese Language Meetup Group

item.name: “Fado Vadio” Photograph Exhibition by Luís Pavão, Film and Reception - FREE
